ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:0.5_0: The training rule on shaking the hand
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate shaking their hand. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat shaking my hand,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.4_0: he should not eat shaking the hands;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats shaking his hand, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.11_0: if he shakes the hand to discard trash;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.15_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on married girls, is finished.
